channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: BME/BMDS Co-terminal Information Session - February 19
item.description: Wednesday, February 19, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Students interested in applying to the co-terminal programs in Biomedical Engineering or Biomedical Data Science are invited to attend a WebEx info session on Feb 19. Email Elizabeth Harwood (harwoe3@rpi.edu) for the WebEx invitation. All non-BME majors must apply by March 1.

item.title: BME Seminar Series Continues February 20
item.description: Date: Thursday, February 20, 2025 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM - Dr. Aaron Morris from the University of Michigan presents Biomaterial Development to Monitor and Treat Autoimmunity.

item.title: Three Minute Thesis Registration - Deadline February 24
item.description: Monday, February 24, 2025 (all day) - Ph.D. students are encouraged to register for the Three Minute Thesis competition. The Three Minute Thesis competition event will be part of the 10th Annual Graduate Research Symposium, scheduled for Friday, April 11, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: Game Development Club Presents Valentine’s Day Game Jam
item.description: Love is in the air! Join the RPI Game Development Club on February 14 at 6 p.m. in Sage 2411 for a Valentine’s Themed Game Jam, and make a Multiplayer Game in 48 hours to play with the special people in your life! Overnight breaks begin at 10:00 PM on both Friday and Saturday nights and doors re-opening at 8:00 AM each morning. Open to all RPI students! Contact Aiden Crossfield (crossa2@rpi.edu) to sign up.
item.author: Students

item.title: GD&T Skills Course Registration Deadline - February 26
item.description: The Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) course is designed as an overview of the topics relating to the application and understanding of GD&T. 12 hours of instruction total. A certificate of completion will be awarded for this class. Students must attend all sessions for certificate. Sessions will be from 5 – 8:00 pm on March 13, 17, 20 & 24 in Troy 2018. Course is Free for RPI students. Class is limited to 20. To sign up email skomsm@rpi.edu.
item.author: Students

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop: “Leading from Anywhere”
item.description: Thursday, February 20, 2025 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM - At Rensselaer, we maintain that “leadership” involves a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. In this workshop, participants will explore the tenants that comprise everyday leadership and discuss the behaviors that define leadership not as positional or based on title, but rather on values and actions.
item.author: Community

item.title: IBM Quantum Support: On-campus Office Hours February 13
item.description: IBM quantum support will be holding open on-campus office hours Thursday, February 13th from 9am to 11am ET in CII 3159. During this time, IBM personnel will be available to answer questions regarding your specific applications about quantum computing, quantum algorithms, and other quantum computer questions you may have. For additional information about RPI Quantum Computing, please visit https://quantum.rpi.edu
item.author: Community

item.title: New Regulations for Methylene Chloride Use
item.description: The U. S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has issued a new rule for methylene chloride (dichloromethane or DCM), a chlorinated solvent commonly used in laboratories and shops. EHS will host information sessions in February to review the rule and assist affected groups with compliance.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer Faculty and Staff Webinar: Flipping Your Classroom - February 18
item.description: Tuesday, February 18, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - This session will discuss the practice of moving traditional in-class lectures onto the web by creating engaging, media-rich content that student’s access before, during, or after class. Class time is refocused, allowing students to work on tasks and problems that apply the concepts they studied independently. Please register
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Important Notice: NY Paid Prenatal Leave
item.description:
Managers and supervisors are encouraged to attend a webinar on Thursday, February 20th at 11:00 am to learn about NY Paid Prenatal Leave. Under this policy, employees who are pregnant or trying to become pregnant receive an additional 20 hours of paid leave for prenatal medical care.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
